title: Self-motile colloidal particles: from directed propulsion to random walk
abstract:
NoThe motion of an artificial micro-scale swimmer that uses a chemical reaction catalyzed on its\ud
own surface to achieve autonomous propulsion is fully characterized experimentally. It is shown\ud
that at short times, it has a substantial component of directed motion, with a velocity that depends\ud
on the concentration of fuel molecules. At longer times, the motion reverts to a random walk with\ud
a substantially enhanced diffusion coefficient. Our results suggest strategies for designing artificial\ud
chemotactic systems
